title.value: Moving shared decision-making forward in Iran
title.justification: The title explicitly mentions the focus on shared decision-making in Iran, aligning with the content of the paper.
title.quote: Moving shared decision-making forward in Iran

extractions.description: This paper discusses the state of shared decision-making (SDM) in Iran, highlighting recent advancements in patient rights and informed consent legislation. Despite these advancements, there is a lack of policies specifically regarding SDM, as well as scarce SDM training and clinical implementation within the country. The paper proposes an adapted SDM model for the Iranian context, developed through a consensus-building process among Iranian clinicians and SDM experts.

type.justification: The paper primarily discusses conceptual frameworks and proposed models for SDM in Iran rather than conducting empirical research or experiments.
type.quote: Lastly, we propose an SDM model adapted to the Iranian context, through a consensus-building process with Iranian clinicians and SDM experts, to assist in its implementation in a culturally sensitive manner.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on shared decision-making practices, its current state, and proposed models for implementation in Iran.
